[]>narrator{icy-aloe-emotion|serious,angel-emotion|neutral,capra-emotion|spiraling,rider-emotion|excited}:A wave of abject horror and held-back laughter crashes through the group.
[]>starry:Bwaha.
[]>crosscull:...
[]>angel:...
[]>capra:Umm...
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Uhh...
[]>starry:Great move.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Yea, that one.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|excited}:Then you better have fun for the five- <ap>six of us, you two!
[]>crosscull:That we will.
[]>icy-aloe:...
[]>capra:...
[]>capra:Hey uhh... I'm sorry if this interrupts but it's getting kinda cold, to be honest.
[]>crosscull: It's getting late too.

[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:It's getting quite late indeed. It's been an absolute pleasure hanging out with you, Capra.
[]>capra: H- huh? <ap>Thank you, yes, same.
[]>starry:Very true.

[]>angel: Will you be fine going home on your own? Where do you even live?
[]>capra: Uhhmm, east. In Galwice.
[]>crosscull: Then I can accompany you. I also live in that direction.
[]>angel: Lovely! Is that fine with you?
[]>capra: Yes, of course.
[]>angel: Then that's settled. Great! Have a safe ride home you two.
[]>crosscull: Likewise. We will be in touch.
[]>angel: That we will! Bye!
[]>capra: Bye everyone.
[]>starry:Get home safely!

[]>narrator:The ride home is uneventful. With Angel gone, the conversation is much less lively, but Crosscull doesn't seem to mind. Xe almost enjoys that silence, it seems. Or maybe xe just hates you. Regardless, Crosscull gets out a few stops before you, you say your goodbyes. <lc>Later that evening, there's some activity on the KommKomm server.

[]>narrator:The ride home is uneventful. You don't know Crosscull, and you're collapsing from social anxiety. It is very quiet between you two. But Crosscull doesn't seem to mind. Xe almost enjoys that silence, it seems. Or maybe xe just hates you. Regardless, Crosscull gets out a few stops before you, you say your goodbyes. <lc>Later that evening, there's some activity on the KommKomm server. A voice call with Icy, Rider, and one name you don't recognize.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Go outside instead. Enough socializing for today.

content.content:
[]>icy-aloe:Capra! So we meet again.
[]>capra:Hi... hi.
[]>rider: Also can't sleep, huh?
[]>capra: Do you also have trouble sleeping?
[]>rider: Yep. that's how it is with insomnia.
[]>capra: I dont know if I have insomnia... But my sleeping schedule is also pretty messed up.
[]>capra:Uh huh.
[]>rider:Yea, Para, we got a new one. She also lives here and was with us at the concert.
[]>para:Heya.

[]>icy-aloe:Did you enjoy your time at the concert?
[]>capra:It was... <ap>okay.
[]>narrator:The road to making friends sucks ass.
[]>icy-aloe:People coming and going in and out of pits is normal. At least we all ended up back together.
[]>capra:It was more so the music. I'm still mixed on it.

[]>rider:We didn't even really get to hang out afterwards much. <lc>How about you join us then again?
[]>capra:I'll think on it. It's quite something to meet this many new people suddenly. <ap>And... <ap>The music isn't really my thing either.
[]>icy-aloe:But Angel and CC are so sweet, aren't they?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I guess.
[]>rider:Just let us know if you wanna tag along.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:...

[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:You're.. I think... the only people I know in Helenia.
[]>rider:That's fucked up. <lc>Where did you come from?
[]>capra:Nowhere.
[]>rider:...
[]>icy-aloe:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I grew up online.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Those were good times, to be honest. I really like the internet.
[]>icy-aloe:We all do.
[]>capra:But I lived in it, you know? It's just getting eroded as a third place now. As a place to hang out and... <mp>Sorry.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I was born here and never left.
[]>icy-aloe:Glad to be meeting you then.
[]>capra:I kinda have to get out. Doomscrolling all day and also during my deadend day job... I don't like it.
[]>rider:Also been there... online. Years ago.
[]>narrator:It's 3:35 AM. The night sky is calling you.
[]>capra:I'm gonna go out for a walk now.
[]>rider:At this god damn hour?
[]>capra:I like the night. 
[]>narrator:That's a vampire thing. <lc>And a former-neet thing.
[]>rider:Well, have fun Capra.
[]>icy-aloe:Stay safe!
[]>para:Oh wait! <mp>Are you also a vampire?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...
[]>para:Because if so that's really cool and we should definitely hang out.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Yeah... Maybe we should.
[]>capra:Bye.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I'm so done. I have such a headache.
[]>narrator:Better not to push it.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I'm just gonna go outside. I think.
[]>narrator:After idling around for a few more minutes, you follow through on that.
[]>narrator:As you step out into the night, The walk relaxes you.

[]>narrator:The next days pass without fanfare. As usual, you awake, drag yourself out of bed and ride the bus to work enshrouded against the sunlight, get weird stares for it, and plop down on your bed face down and full of sadness. <lc> Sometimes, you write a bit.

[]>narrator:And then, finally, the weekend arrives.
[]>narrator:A new day dawns, its time to get depressed <lc>Booting up your PC is the first thing you do on weekends like today.

[]>doomfeed:"This week saw an escalation of violence across southern Doszbian."
[]>narrator:That's where you live, by the way.
[]>doomfeed:"Within the last week, a consistent spike across the region in reported assaults was noted by law enforcement."
[]>narrator:You switch over to another news source. <ap>A more local one.
[]>doomfeed:"Allegedly, the assaults and batteries are targeted at vampires. Of the 14 attacked, 5 of which are still in the ICU, 8 and 3 respectively were confirmed to be vampires themselves, or associates thereof."
[]>narrator:As the sun sets, there's still life on the KommKomm server. Nothing evades your gaze. And almost nothing evades your apathy either. <mp>Almost nothing.
[]>narrator: It's Rider, hanging out in the voice chat, streaming to no one.
[]>narrator:This is too much sociality for you.
[]>narrator:It might be good to do a followup to the concert. Better this than rotting with depression all weekend again.
[]>narrator:You're not gonna sit on the sidelines forever.

[]>rider: Ayo.
[]>capra: Hi...
[]>rider: We haven't met before, right?
[]>narrator: This was SUCH a big mistake
[]>capra: Yea... I mean no. Well, We haven't. 
[]>rider: Gotcha.<lc>Who are you?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Uhhh... Capra. I joined here some time ago because I saw the invite link around my area.
[]>icy-aloe:Also, we talked recently!

[]>icy-aloe:Had a nice little chat about the state of things. And the server and the community center.
[]>rider:The community center?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I'm... umm... <mp>Kinda from here.
[]>icy-aloe:Just general leftism and stuff.

[]>icy-aloe:Getting another one introduced to anti-psychiatry.
[]>narrator:There's a really smug tone in their voice.
[]>rider:Fucking awesome.

[]>rider:Did you just join?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:No. Like I said, a while back. <ap>...<ap>Just took a while to work up courage to call with someone here.
[]>rider: Okay, I'm Rider. I do a bunch of shit around here. <lc>We were at a concert with friends yesterday!
[]>capra: What kind of concert?
[]>rider:You probably don't know the bands, but we also didn't. It was doomed hardcore.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Uh huh.
[]>rider:Not that familiar with it? 
[]>capra: Not really. Sorry if this is too much, but what is that?
[]>rider: Oh just music. Thick and thumpy and loud, that kinda shit.
[]>capra:That's really not my thing.
[]>icy-aloe:What type of music do you listen to?
[]>capra:If I'm honest, not much. Not really.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Mostly video game music.
[]>icy-aloe:Are you big into games, too?
[]>capra:You could say that.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:I really like speedrunning.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Weird, I know.
[]>icy-aloe:But super cool!
[]>rider:We don't game much these days anymore.
[]>icy-aloe:Way more outgoing, concerts, and stuff.
[]>rider:Gonna be going to one on Christmas on all days for fuck's sake. Kinda funny. You also wouldn't like it, Capra. The headliner band is called Nuclear Infanticide.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:That sounds gruesome. That really doesn't sound like something for me.

[]>narrator:talk more
[]>rider:If it's not your music taste, you don't have to come along.
[]>icy-aloe:But your're still welcome to.

[]>rider:Yea it's like death metal and stuff.
[]>icy-aloe:But as with all things everyone one this server is invited, just let the rest know beforehand.
[]>capra:[center]I yearn for connection.[/center]

[]>capra:Could I come with?
[]>rider:When I tell you about a concert that's already me being fine with you being there. Besides, not like that matters anyhow. Just... fucking come along if you want!<lc>...<lc>Hell yea.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Okay... I'll think on it.
[]>capra:Nuclear infanticide... what a name. I'll think on it.

[]>rider:Well, it's getting late and Starry forgot to leave some dinner for me.
[]>capra:Oh no, I'm sorry.
[]>rider:It's fine. Just gonna chow down on some instant noodles.
[]>capra:I also like those.
[]>icy-aloe:Got the health squad over here.
[]>rider:It's good. <mp>Anyways, bye!
[]>capra:Bye.
[]>icy-aloe:I'll also head to bed now. Talk to you later!
[]>narrator:It's difficult to grasp you could just finally be somewhere.
[]>narrator:[center]On Desire.[/center]

[]>metaspirit:We need to talk. <mp>There's the possibility, not the certainty, but a possibility that you will need to make some difficult choices in the future.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Huh? <ap>Would you please elaborate?
[]>metaspirit:And you are required to know who you are. Why you are.<lc>What do you use to inform your choices?

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Whatever disturbs me least, I guess. <mp>I'm sorry to say I don't have many aspirations besides not suffering.
[]>metaspirit:Pain avoidance...
[]>capra:Kind of.
[]>metaspirit:The world will not be friendly to those that do not live for something.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Whatever will give me most joy. Headstrong optimism.
[]>metaspirit:It is difficult to believe.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I'll admit being clinically depressed is making it hard to do that on most days. <ap>But when you allow me to make an actual, informed decision, I'll only focus on what I gain from it.

[]>capra:I guess... I have my moral compass?
[]>metaspirit:Which is informed by?
[]>capra:What feels right, I guess?
[]>metaspirit:A blind hedonist...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Well... not really. I will do things that feel bad to me if I think they are correct for society. <mp>It's part of the reason why I would also never kill myself with a train or truck. That can scar people for life.

[]>narrator:Anti-vampire legislature
[]>narrator:"Following a series of assaults that have now resulted in the death of at least one person, the government is looking into consequences and prevention." "the de-fang bill aims to curtail showing of vampirism outside with the goal of reducing the number of targeted attacks."
[]>narrator:Racism
[]>narrator:A trial that has gone on for 18 years is about to conclude. This goes back to when a series of decisions by the agricultural lobby caused the supplement prices for vampirism-related medication to skyrocket. It is rumored that one kid from your kindergarden back then died because of this. <ap>You never looked into it.
[]>doomfeed:"Almost two decades after the iron root shortage-"
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:At the fault of no one, of course.
[]>doomfeed:"The trial is now coming to an end. The Supreme Doszbian Court has found Hemotech to be party responsible for the incurred costs from medical costs of iron-deficiency-related emergencies that affected parts of the population in 2002. Affected members of vampiric populations that can prove their afflictions within the noted timeframe can be eligible for a payout equal to their hospital costs, but for no longer than a continuous three week period."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:So a big middle finger. How unsurprising. 
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Not like it matters anyways.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:As the late evening drags on, you receive a phone call. <ap>A deeply unpleasant noise that you always forget to mute. <mp>It's your dad.
[]>narrator:You never even looked at their text but that doesn't matter to him. <lc>He's possessive like that.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Do not pick up the phone.

content.content: []>dad{dad-emotion|phone}:Pasta salad.
[]>dad{dad-emotion|phone}:Still, enjoy the presence of your friends.

[]>narrator:The phone goes silent. <lc>You talk so little these days, you don't even know what he could want. <mp>Really, you're just waiting for the day when he finally cannot split you from the groups he so viciously hates anymore.
[]>narrator:Your dad is not one to call repeatedly, so just a few minutes later, you receive a text instead.

[]>dad{dad-emotion|text}:Hello [deadname.].<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<lc>This christmas, I thought of doing pasta salad again. Like in the good old times.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Just keep breathing,
[]>narrator:Behind a thin veil of nostalgia for a long-dead you, there is nothing. This is no question or anything.
[]>dad:I could pick you up at your nice new apartment. <mp>And then you can kill yourself.
[]>narrator:That's not what it says.
[]>dad:I could pick you up at your nice new apartment. And then you don't have to go by bus. <lc>Dad.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I've lived here for ages.
[]>narrator:Almost two years.
[]>capra:More than enough. <mp>It's not directed at me, I'll...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Oh sigh...
[]>narrator:Acknowledging within dissociation, you close the text.

[]>dad{dad-emotion|text}:Hello [deadname.].<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<lc>This christmas, I am sad that you're not with us. I am doing pasta salad again. Like in the good old times.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Uh huh.
[]>narrator:Beyond dissociation, there is nothing.
[]>dad:I wish you a Merry Christmas. <lc>Dad.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Anything but this right now.
[]>narrator:You flip your phone on its screen and put it on the desk on the other side of the room.
[]>capra:Anything but this...

[]>narrator:As the phone screen goes black again, the conversation that just transpired leaves your brain again, and your self returns. <lc>His threats might not leave you unscarred...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:But they're nothing against some targeted dissociation.
[]>narrator:Your brain is fried. Exhausted and bleeding on the floor. Within a few days, your life has become so so much.

[]>narrator:This deserves an entry in your mood diary.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I keep forgetting this... Damn.
[]>narrator:You pick up a ball-point pen and scrawl on the next best paper surface. <mp>A carton, former prison of frozen pizza.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:"My parents can go fuck themselves."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:"I need to look into... Artihem."<lc>"Angel mentioned it at the concert."

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:"Also, I might be going positively insane. I think."
[]>narrator:You shift your eyes around. No metaspirit in sight.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:"Overall, I'm doing fine. Or bad...<ap>I'm doing as usual."
[]>narrator:With tape and blind faith, you add it to the pile of loose papers and printouts that you call your mood diary.

[]>narrator:You awake to icy winds blowing through your tilted window. The sky is already dressed in pale blue, which means it's already well past morning. <mp>A sense of foreboding and catastrophy envelops your heart and you accept the fate of your toes getting broken off by the frigid cold. <lc>It's christmas morning.
[]>capra:... <lc>*sigh*<lc>...<lc>...
[]>narrator:It goes on like this. <ap>Eyes directed at the ceiling, and the inertia of your soul chaining you down to your mattress.<lc>If you were the universe, time would cease its motion over and over, until you are spurred, like today as well, by the realization that it moves without relent around you after all.
[]>capra:...<lc>............<lc>....
[]>narrator: A crane of the neck and a roll of the head and your hazy eyes glance outside the window past the curtains. <lc>A bout of clouds is making its way across the horizon.
[]>capra: How pretty. I love you.
[]>narrator: The outside reciprocates by sending a lovely flock of migratory birds towards the sun. <mp>Your inner eye sees them all die and fall out of the sky. Harbinger of death.<lc>The birds continue flying.<lc>You erect your torso, and get up. <mp>When you check your phone, it is almost noon.
[]>narrator:You make some tea, and sit down. The sense of nothingness is overwhelming, your plans for the evening ever yet uncertain until you are within them.
[]>narrator:Christmas evening arrived faster than you were prepared for. It is late afternoon. <mp>You have to do something.
[]>narrator:You told you parents you'd come. <lc>Doesn't mean you have to.

[]>narrator:You cancelled on your parents. Not like you care much about them anyways. They might be hurt?
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:But what does it matter anyways? <ap>They are so irrelevant.

[]>narrator:Angel's offer to join her and Crosscull at the queer club is making your social anxiety as bad as it can get. People probably have sex there. Possibly even doing drugs. And worst of all, you don't know anyone but Angel and Crosscull and who can say if they'll have time to babysit you. Yea that's right, it wouldn't be hanging out, you'd just be a burden on them.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Oh my god kill me now. can't my parents just fucking dissolve. and me too. just end this family outright.

[]>narrator: Rider's offer to join them at another concert would give you a good excuse to not go to your parents' place. Assuming you want to explain to them that you don't want to visit them. <lc>All you have to endure for that is another two or three hours of standing there awkwardly while everyone's enjoying themselves. You'd only be in the way of the other concert-goers anyways.<lc>You could also always just not go anywhere. Cooped up in your room, like most holidays. It's not like this family shit matters to you anyways.
[]>narrator:Where will you go?

choices.choice_text.enabled: Go to the concert with Rider, Icy, and Starry.
Go to the bar with Angel and Crosscull.
Throw yourself into uncertainty, go to the concert Rider mentioned.

content.content:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I don't need. Others. No desire. <lc>Can all go fuck themselves.
[]>narrator:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Oops. No swearing in this household.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Sigh... so what now?

[]>narrator:A call. <mp>Your mom.
[]>mom{mom-emotion|phone}:Where are you? Did something happen to you?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:No, mom.
[]>mom:To think my own son would stand up his parents on christmas.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I'm sorry.
[]>mom:Do you at least have an explanation?
[]>capra:I just didn't feel like going outside.
[]>mom:That takes the cake. Well I hope you are happy like that.
[]>capra:Thank you. <mp>Merry christmas.
[]>mom:To you too. Goodbye.
[]>capra:Bye.

[]>narrator:Telling you parents you'll be there on christmas and then not showing up. Great.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Not like it matters anyways.
[]>narrator:Maybe a little drink won't hurt now.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:It definitely won't.
[]>narrator:Vodka, tequila, rum, and cola all find their way into your glass, and then you find solace with your two-thirds-complete long island ice tea.

[]>narrator:You set yourself down on your bed, face directed up at the ceiling. The sudden rush of numbness from the lack of food and excess of spirits in your body makes the deafening silence more bearable.
[]>narrator:[center]On Temporality and Premonition[/center]

[]>metaspirit:You are doing disastrously unwell.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:No shit.
[]>metaspirit:Where are your decisions evaluated?
[]>capra:Why must you be so cryptic?
[]>capra:Nowhere? <mp>The universe doesn't care.
[]>metaspirit:No, Capra. You are your own person. When do you decide to evaluate your choices?
[]>capra:The past.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:If you couldn't see by now, my life is too much for me. <mp>I just look at what was good in the past and... <ap>cling to that.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I've read a few things online that this might be more mentall illness.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:And I know you're also not supposed to compare yourself to others. <ap>Or your happier past self.<lc>But that's just how it is.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}: I regret some things.
[]>metaspirit{capra-emotion|anger}:I know.
[]>narrator:You stare daggers into its eyeless head.
[]>capra: And- <ap> And I don't want them to repeat. <lc>So I keep in mind what I can learn from the past and become better that way.
[]>metaspirit:...<lc>Beware of becoming eclipsed by your past.
[]>capra:As if there's anything else.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I see it quite pragmatically. Our past contextualizes our present decisions. <mp>So really, there is nothing to value- <ap>evaluate, I mean.
[]>metaspirit:Self-reified determinism.
[]>capra:Sure. I guess.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:To be honest, I don't know what any of those words mean.
[]>metaspirit:You see everything as a consequence of the past?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:And that past should've been made with the best intentions for everyone.
[]>metaspirit:And what if the past does not suffice?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I don't know.<lc>I give up, I guess.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I straight up do not care.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:About anything like that.
[]>capra:The past cannot be altered, the future is yet to be certain. The present is the only relevant thing.

[]>capra:I just follow my instincts and do what feels good in the moment.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:That's how I'm slowly but surely developing more and more substance abuse issues.

[]>capra:but as long as you minimize friction, it should never come up.
[]>metaspirit:but it can compound. just like your drug habits.
[]>capra:Then I'll kill myself when it comes back to haunt me.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I have all the info I need before me. The second I decide I'll reach the other side of that decision.
[]>metaspirit:Do you? <mp> And will you?
[]>capra:Do I what and will I what?
[]>metaspirit:Do you have all the information before you?
[]>capra:I know as much as possible.
[]>metaspirit:And that is objective?
[]>capra:I think so.
[]>metaspirit:It's the guise of objectivity. <mp>And even if it were absolute truth, will you get an answer as soon as you think of if your so-called objective decision was good?
[]>capra:According to how time works, yes.

[]>capra:The future.
[]>metaspirit:Quite typical for those with presentimental proclivities.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Yes, about that. <lc>What does that mean, exactly?
[]>metaspirit:It means you can see the future.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I can what? Sorry, but I don't believe you.
[]>metaspirit:It is not as you might think. <lc>Premonition does not equate omniscience. <mp>It just means that you may know the sequence of specific events, or fragmented motivators without knowing where they lead.<lc>What you speak can be what you manifest. Now, Capra:
[]>metaspirit:How do you think about the future?

[]>capra: There's one mental image I like to come back to over and over. It's kinda like this. 
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Draw one point in the future out to the present. <ap>And burn away the rest.
[]>metaspirit:Aspirations-driven?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:If you want to put it that way.
[]>metaspirit:And what are your current ones?
[]>capra:My current what?
[]>metaspirit:Aspirations.
[]>capra:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Okay I have to admit there's a lot of hate in me right now and not much else.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Eventually, I'd like to cease to be. Until then, I'll just focus on how much burden I can take away from my future self.
[]>metaspirit:And what are those burdens?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Right now? <mp>Living in a genocidal state. <mp>Having shitty parents that don't support me. <mp>Being depressed.
[]>capra:I can affect maybe some of those. <mp>Mostly with murder directed at me or my parents.

[]>capra:I constantly think about the impact of my actions on others. It gets intrusive sometimes.
[]>metaspirit:You live by judgment.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:You're almost as good as my therapist.

[]>metaspirit:Capra, I must warn you. The path you are on right now is not one lightly-treaded.
[]>capra:What path? You gave me a question. I just gave you an answer. That's what you have to accept.
[]>metaspirit:Just because you are blind to your own conviction, does not neccessitate they hold not fast.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Please let me get back to languishing now... I'd really like that.
[]>narrator:The evening has gone on long enough.
[]>narrator:Just as you are about to head to bed, you get a text from Icy Aloe inviting you over.
[]>narrator:liquid courage
[]>narrator:social anxiety

[]>narrator:It's christmas and they're your parents. Of course you're gonna visit them. <mp>It's still a few hours until you want to show up there, so you do pretty much nothing as you rot on the couch for a few hours.
[]>narrator:Eventually though, you find yourself in the outskirts of the city. Families live here. <mp>As do your parents.

[]>narrator:You make your way through the sleet. The verticality of the city is really noticeable, as these houses are up high enough to even have anything resembling snowfall. <lc>Dragging your feet, you shovel the grimy sludge before you, kicking up pebbles and staining the cuffs of your pants. <mp>By the time you arrive at your parents' apartment block, your shins are positively dripping, and your toes are freezing.<lc>Shivering, and with a dead-eyed stare, you ring the door bell.<lc>The buzz of the door disturbs the winter silence and you make your way upstairs, where you find a closed door.

[]>narrator:You knock on the door.
[]>mom:Hi darling! We're of course so glad you could make it.
[]>narrator:You exchange pleasantries, and your mom ushers you inside. <mp>Your dad is in the living room, presumably.

[]>narrator:You enter it, and find that presumption confirmed. You step in and the space is filled with the stench of an aimless TV program and patriarchy. Your dad has the news on as background noise. He turns towards you.
[]>dad:I'm happy to see you, <ap>[deadname].
[]>capra:Hello Dad.
[]>mom:Say Dear, fancy a tea? Or something else to drink?
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:She's talking to you.
[]>capra:Thank you mom. I'll take... <ap>Whatever you have. Thank you.
[]>mom:Join me then Dear, in the kitchen.

[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:She brushes your arm, no- takes it and drags you into the kitchen. <mp>You want to run.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Thank you.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:Don't forget to hide your fangs. <lc>You don't think they'd notice.
[]>mom:So how was the ride here?
[]>capra:It was a bus ride... it was okay.
[]>mom:That's good. <lc>So, how would you like some fresh rosehip tea?
[]>capra:Gladly.
[]>narrator:She continues making smalltalk with you, and when the tea is done, you emerge back in the living room.

[]>dad:Been well, son?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Yea. I've been... fine.
[]>dad:Good.
[]>narrator:You continue sipping your tea.
[]>dad:I gotta wear this damned brace now.
[]>narrator:He pulls up his pants' leg and shows you a brace around his ankle.
[]>dad:Kinked it at work. <mp>Ah your old man is old.
[]>capra:Sad. <mp>What happened?
[]>dad:Damned icy surfaces a few weeks back. Almost fell.
[]>mom:I had to pick him up from the ER, child.
[]>dad:It's nothn.<lc>Have to wear the brace for some more weeks now.<lc>Shame I can't run like before, when we two played. <ap>Those were good times, weren't they?
[]>narrator:His nostalgia is almost endearing.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:They were.
[]>narrator:If you could remember any of those years.
[]>dad:All over... <ap>all over...
[]>mom:And how are jobs going for you? A fine young rascal like you can find something, can't he?
[]>capra:Yea... <mp>I'm looking.
[]>capra:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:One moment...
[]>dad:[deadname]?
[]>narrator:You turn away, towards the hallway door.
[]>capra:Sorry, I gotta go to the bathroom.
[]>mom:Are you fine?
[]>narrator:You're already out of the living room.

[]>narrator:Within seconds after locking the door, you find yourself wretching over the toilet bowl but nothing comes out. Your soul is afflicted with poison, and your parents are the IV injecting it.
[]>capra:H... hhrrh.
[]>narrator:Heaving, and head spinning, your chest is wound tight.
[]>metaspirit:[center]On the benefit of suffering[/center]

[]>metaspirit:Capra. Why do you put yourself in such distress?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:!!!
[]>narrator:If looks could kill.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Qurkk... ugh.
[]>narrator:It continues hovering in your periphery.
[]>capra:Quiet... <ap>down. Please.
[]>metaspirit:I cannot be seen by your parents. And if you have not noticed it yet, you also do not audibly talk to me. It is akin to mumbling to yourself at the most. Speaking without your voice, Capra.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Heh... I'd never thought I'd hear that name in this household.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Leave... this place.
[]>metaspirit:If only you knew how powerful your words can be. <mp>But I will not leave.
[]>capra:Of course you won't.
[]>metaspirit:The words of vampires are powerful, Capra.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Die.
[]>metaspirit:You don't mean it.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...<lc>And when I do... <mp>Is that like like how I can just talk myself into and out of depression when I want to?
[]>metaspirit:That's not a matter related to vampirism. <mp>But yes. <lc>...<lc>Why do you endure your parents so?
[]>capra:Because I have other family. <mp>My life would be better if my parents were dead. That's out of the question. <ap>But my grandma is too sweet to see our family break apart.<lc>When she dies, that'll be when I'll finally let my family-self die.
[]>metaspirit:You're a strong vampire, and a strong woman....
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Don't call me that. <ap>Not here.
[]>metaspirit:I did not mean to hurt you. I apologize.
[]>capra:Whatever.
[]>metaspirit:I am rivited by the prospect of you succeeding.
[]>capra:...<lc>I don't want to see her sad. That's all.

[]>narrator:You look in the mirror, standing on the verge of tears. <mp>You look down that cliff and back at you gazes the abyss.<lc>Under your breath, you race through your thoughts.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Deadname, manliness, I hate them so much. <lc>Get me out, please.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Why can't I just keel over and die? <lc>I want to leave.
[]>narrator:But you can't.
[]>capra:Not without arousing suspicion.
[]>narrator:You're already spending the least possible time here.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Kill me.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Mmmm. Blegh.
[]>narrator:The wavering astral forces trapped in the mirror project an ugly and decrepit husk.
[]>capra:Try not to vomit.

[]>narrator:You find yourself idly standing in the middle of the bathroom. No one seems to have come barging in, so you can't have been gone for that long yet. <mp>You should get back to your parents.

[]>narrator:You return from the bathroom. Both of your parents turn to you with worried faces.
[]>mom:Is everything alright, Dear?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Yes, mom. No worries.
[]>mom:I'm glad to hear that.
[]>dad:Did you vomit? Sounded like it.
[]>capra:No, I'm fine.
[]>narrator:He shrugs and turns back to face the coffee table. You parents don't have an actual dinner table. <mp>You were shocked and confused when you learned other people did.
[]>narrator:It seems that, before you came back in, your dad was just preparing another can of tea, a different blend this time.
[]>dad:Look, [deadname]. Isn't this nice?
[]>narrator:He points at the sieve he uses to filter out tea leaf particulates from the can's brew before they hit the cup.
[]>dad:You can't get quality like that anymore. It's already tattered but still good. <ap>At least good enough for the rough tea.
[]>capra:Yep.
[]>dad:Haha, gotcha. Disgusting little bugger.
[]>narrator:He's caught one of the bits of tea that fell through the sieve.
[]>mom:...
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:The TV switches to a news broadcast on the Phean War.
[]>dad:All of those biters from Leventia... <ap>Or Lethonia, coming to us.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Dad, those are like... entirely different countries. They have very different histories and stuff.
[]>dad:You know how I mean it. <mp>You know I don't take those things that exact.
[]>capra:...
[]>dad:Should just die for their country.
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:Your mom and you exchange glances. You don't know how approving she is of this.
[]>mom:Should I refill your tea? Do you want some food?
[]>narrator:...approving enough to still be married to him.
[]>capra:I'll just take some tea, thank you. I'm not that hungry yet I think.
[]>mom:Don't fall apart now here.
[]>dad:Have you had those migrants come to your district yet?
[]>capra:Not really, no. 
[]>dad:That's good. 
[]>capra:How do you mean?
[]>dad:Wouldn't want them around me, that's for sure.
[]>capra:Sure.
[]>dad:Point is, we had witches come here when I was your age, maybe a bit younger, and that didn't go too well, as you may know. <mp> I don't need any murderous bloodsuckers coming here and ruining our country..
[]>capra:Again, very different groups.
[]>dad:Watch your mouth, now.

[]>narrator:You don't know what escalating the situation would do, so you let it slide. Your father drones on.
[]>dad:You know, [deadname], when I was about your age, we had a few witches too. Fine gals. <lc>But eventually they got too uppity.<lc>It's just like all of those repression champions these days, saying everything is oppressing them. 
[]>mom:Sometimes we should listen to others though, don't you think?
[]>dad:Ah, listen, Sonia, if we always listened to everyone, we wouldn't get anything done. <lc>Not as if you'd know anything about that, ha.
[]>narrator:He shoots you a glance, "Women, am I right?". How your mom can stay with this guy is beyond you.

[]>dad:And look, why do we have to have these arguments anyways? My pals and I, the rascals, from way back when at the chop shop, we alsohuv some differences in opinion. And, and when we meet up. Well let's just say we can put that aside and we don't talk about politics.<lc>Why can't we do that too?
[]>narrator:Silence. Is your dad even talking *to* anyone?
[]>dad:What you're talking about, [deadname], isn't even accurate.
[]>capra:Okay?
[]>dad:All-a those here differences. <mp>They really aren't there. If Leventia or Lethonia. Those Saramese and Neolites... They have a few diners here and- and I don't taste any differences. <lc>They don't have to divide into all that.
[]>narrator:You wish you knew what any of this has to do with anything.
[]>mom:But statements like those are exactly why they might noe feel welcome here, don't you think?
[]>dad:Well I donwannem here.
[]>narrator:You say your goodbyes, and off you go.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Dad. I'm sick and tired of your bullshit.
[]>narrator:Your parents seem taken aback by your vocalization.
[]>capra:You keep not giving a single fuck about anything of this damn country, and even within it, I think your concerns are absolutely...<ap> wild. <lc>Witches got hunted in the 70s because you all decided they didn't deserve to live, not because they were statistically any different than you or me.
[]>dad:And where do you take those numbers from? The government?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Lived accounts by actual people... and yes, studies and surveys.
[]>dad:You always with your surveys, can't trust 'em.
[]>capra:...
[]>dad:So you'd just let all of them in here, and do as they please?
[]>capra:Yes, damn it.
[]>dad:And what if those biters got you, huh? Would you just give your blood to someone who doesn't give anything in return?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Yes. Because I have empathy.
[]>dad:Are you saying I don't have empathy?
[]>mom:[deadname], please...
[]>capra:Possibly.
[]>dad:Well that takes the cake.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Vampirism is not just about wanting to bite someone occasionally. And it's not transmissable. Their fangs literally grow out and then they need to consume hemoglobin to survive. It's a medical need. <lc>They don't kill random people and there's vegan supplements out there even. <lc>There is just no need to be this hostile towards them.
[]>dad:I'm not judging all of them.
[]>dad:There was that one biter a few years back on TV...
[]>capra:Don't use that word.
[]>dad:Excuse me?
[]>capra:Don't call vampires biter.
[]>dad:What do you know about that huh? When I grew up, I was taught it was okay to say.<lc>What? Just because you've taken a few college classes on history you suddenly know everything?
[]>dad:Accusingly, his finger is pointed at you, hand raised right towards your face.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I don't.
[]>dad:Then don't lecture me with your heart-of-gold insanity.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I'm just saying you could read up on developments from the last 50 years every once in a while. <ap>And not just blindly hate others.
[]>dad:As if it matters to you.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:It does.
[]>dad:Or is it because you're all knowledgeable on you self-victimizers because you're a faggot with a few dicks in his mouth?
[]>mom:Henry!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Just shut the fuck up.
[]>dad:Repeat that?
[]>capra:I said shut up.
[]>dad:I think you said something else too.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Perhaps I did.
[]>dad:Well yeah, perhaps you should learn some manners then, young man.
[]>capra:I'm gonna leave.
[]>dad:Fine then.
[]>mom:Please don't. <ap>I want our family to be at peace at least on Christmas.
[]>capra:I'm sorry mom. <ap>I just can't with him.
[]>mom:...
[]>dad:Oh yeah, now it's all my fault again.
[]>narrator:He stands up to leave.
[]>capra:I've had enough.
[]>narrator:You pack your stuff and leave without another word.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:[center]I want my parents to fucking die.[/center]

[]>narrator:You step outside into the night, a small drizzle now giving shape to the light cones of the streetlamps.
[]>capra:I'm so done with this shit.
[]>narrator:The wet squelching of your chucks is the only soundscape filling the air.

[]>narrator:Some people from the hot sauce enjoyers server should be hanging out in meatspace right now. Maybe they'd mind you showing up unannounced, but it'd always beat spiraling into depression at home. Right?
[]>narrator:There's not many places to go at this hour. It's christmas evening, and your hate your family.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Hang out with Rider and the rest. They're probably getting blazed right now.
Angel and Crosscull are at that queer bar they mentioned. Go there.

content.content: []>narrator:Rain continues to fall

[]>narrator:On your way home, you stop by a gas station.
[]>capra:Hi, four of those small herbal liquors please.
[]>gas-station-clerk:Here you go.
[]>capra:Thank you. <ap>Thanks.
[]>narrator:You start downing them like sweet confections. Soon, the effects start setting in.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Come to think of it, fuck my parents.
[]>narrator:Fuck your parents.

choices.choice_text.enabled: God no, that's so fucking stupid, Capra.

content.content:
[]>narrator:Good.
[]>capra:Yea, maybe not. <ap>Still, I wish they'd dissolve.

[]>narrator:You continue walking.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:It really is pitch-black out here.
[]>narrator:As has become the norm in most winter months, snow is nowhere to be seen. Instead, you all find yourselves drenched by rain.

[]>rider{rider-emotion|irritated}:Man, fuck this.
[]>starry:It's kinda a generational thing. The I Don't Need An Umbrella thing.
[]>rider:At least I have style.
[]>icy-aloe:Sodden garments. Lovely.
[]>rider:My fucking patches and stuff...
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Can't wait to finally get inside.
[]>capra:I like the rain. I enjoy it.

[]>narrator:Eventually, after a few just-above-freezing minutes, you get up to the bouncer to present your tickets. He stops Rider.
[]>bouncer:Lose the terrorism apologia
[]>rider{rider-emotion|irritated}:...The what?
[]>bouncer:The scarf. <ap>Those Liberation Front terrorists use the same symbol.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:They're... they're fighting against imperialism.
[]>bouncer:Alright. Get out of my sight.

[]>rider:Just what is your problem? We're just here to enjoy the concert.
[]>bouncer:You're looking for trouble with that getup. Now stop holding up the queue, and take it off if you want to enter.
[]>narrator:Starry already started turning away.
[]>icy-aloe:You're scum.
[]>rider:Let him be, Icy.
[]>narrator:Rider is just a few steps behind Starry, hand on Icy's shoulder. <lc>The bouncer shoots you a look. <ap>Unsure what to do about this, you follow the others.

[]>rider{rider-emotion|irritated}:Man, what the fuck.
[]>starry:Where do you wanna go now?
[]>narrator:You're all starting to get cold.
[]>rider:Fucking... <ap>My place? We could just hang out there?
[]>capra:I'm okay with that.
[]>icy-aloe:Same.
[]>starry:Then let's go.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Then back to the tram station we go.

[]>icy-aloe:Didn't Angel and Crosscull mention going to a party?
[]>rider:Uhhh... maybe. <ap>But I have no idea where.
[]>icy-aloe:We could ask if they want to join us. Afterwards.
[]>starry:I doubt they'll check their phones this soon.
[]>rider:Well if not it's their fucking loss and more weed for us.
[]>starry:Yeah, just tell them it's a skill issue.
[]>icy-aloe:I will not.
[]>capra:But maybe we could text them? Just in case they might have time?
[]>icy-aloe:On it.
[]>rider:Sweet.

[]>narrator:omg there's blntsmken here. <lc>[insert a lot more text]
[]>capra:So this is your apartment huh
[]>rider:Starry and I live here.
[]>rider:We should have enough beer around for all of us.
[]>rider:We should even have a bottle of that orange soda you got at the concert lying around here... somewhere.
[]>rider:I have no idea what you wanna drink Capra, so just have at it.
[]>capra:I will piss now
[]>narrator:you piss

[]>metaspirit:I'm proud of you.
[]>capra:also, I was wondering... Why do you always appear when I'm in the bathroom?
[]>metaspirit: It makes for good pacing.
[]>capra:Pacing? Pacing of what?
[]>metaspirit:The cadence of the empty cosmos.

[]>narrator: It feels like the universe just crashed on top of you and then immediately sunk right through you.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:ugh... what was that?
[]>metaspirit:you may know in time, Capra.<lc>And another reason why a bathroom is convenient Is that time does not stop when you talk to me. So unless I want you to have two conversations at once, I cannot just barge in there.

[]>narrator:You close the bathroom door behind you, leaving the revenant behind. <mp>Maybe it alone decides when to leave you be. <lc>Absent in thought, you almost trip over the doorstep on your way back to the living room. <mp>Maybe it's best to discard the prospect of you never having had any privacy in that bathroom for now.

[]>narrator: "Ayo I'd like to come with" <lc>You deliberate. Maybe there's another, better, wording. More appropriate? Can you ever find such a thing? <mp>Backspace.<lc>"please take me with you"<lc>Backspace.<lc>"hiiiiii"<lc>Backspace.<lc>"Is the offer to join the two of you at the club still valid?"<lc>Will they hate you if you are too awkward or formal about this? >ou definitely shouldn't be too formal, but also not so casual you impose on them. Right? <mp>Backspace.<lc>"I'd also come with tonight if it's fine with you."<lc> But they invited you. And. And. <ap>What if you just tricked them? <lc> You delete and re-type the message about 5 more times. And then you hit send. <lc>"Can I still come to Citrine with you?" <mp>Definitely not the best wording of the bunch you went through. But your brain has dissolved itself now and there's no rectifying this anyways. You chuck the phone onto your bed and it does a little bounce. <mp>Then you await a response.

[]>narrator: Not even 2 minutes later, you get an answer from Angel. <lc> "Sure thing! Crosscull is already here and we wanna head out in a bit. How's meeting at the station sound?" Not fully sure of the extent of alternatives, you agree, and a few minutes later, you head out.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Ugh.
[]>narrator:The sun.
[]>capra:It's a deadly laser.
[]>narrator:Despite the pale winter sun setting on the horizon already, it's still enough to make you flinch.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Screw this... <mp>I already want to go back home.
[]>narrator:Maybe you should.
[]>capra:Maybe I should.
[]>narrator:Your turn back around.<lc>You aim your keys back at the lock.<lc>Your heart stings.
[]>capra:I can't just turn around like this. <mp>I told them I'd be there.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Why...
[]>narrator:Tears are percolating in your eyes.
[]>capra:I can't.

[]>narrator:You look down on your phone. <ap>A notification from Angel.<lc>You open it.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I'm so pathetic.
[]>narrator:The image of Angel's and Crossculls legs and boots stirs in your brain. "on our way now" the caption reads.
[]>capra:I can't just bail again.
[]>narrator:You turn around again, and pull up your hood. <ap>Destined to reach the train station.<lc>On your way, you send a thumbs up reaction back.
[]>narrator: The train ride is uneventful. The events of just a few minutes ago feel so distant already, your uncertainties now replaced with the usual calm before the storm of social anxiety.

[]>narrator:When you step outside, your heart starts racing. <mp>When the train starts Departing again, it is pounding. <mp>When you hear Angel, fight or flight has already started kicking in and the skies are ever clear.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}: Capra!
[]>crosscull: Good to meet again.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}: Spiraling...
[]>angel: How are you?
[]>capra:...good
[]>angel:Awesome!
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:I really like this place. We can just walk there from here.
[]>crosscull: Only 14 minutes.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}: I can handle walking.
[]>angel: Very good. That's super practical. Then let's go!
[]>narrator: And so you do.

[]>narrator: The three of you leave the train station. You trot up the overhead bridge, and walk through a low density part of town. Trees line your way, and several rivulets are all bridged by sleek minimalist footpath bridges.
